question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-abstract-gas-usage/src/algebra_helpers.rs] [Function: aggregate_terms()] [Integer Overflow] Can an attacker craft a malicious gas expression with repeated identical GasParam terms that causes the coefficient accumulation at line 97 (*entry.get_mut() += 1) to overflow u64::MAX, wrapping to zero and allowing transactions to execute with zero gas cost? (Critical)

(Critical)
